{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3177930,"name":"Mihai Nicoara","username":"MrPresident","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrpresident/{size}/196728_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-31T15:02:41.433Z","cooked":"

Github with code: https://github.com/FRC4418/2023_Offseason_Swerve/tree/YAGSL

In the swerveSubsystem im trying to use the SwerveParser exactly like they do in the documentation but im getting an ioException becuase of a missing file. I have all the nessecary files in the deploy directory. Can anyone please look at my deploy directory/how im calling that method and see where the error is coming from?
Thank you in advance

I took and look and dont see anything obviously missing or wrong. Can you share the full stacktrace?

Here is the error, the lines indicated are the top and bottom of the try catch statement.
Error at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:641): Unhandled exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.revrobotics.MotorFeedbackSensor
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:641)
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoaders.java:188)
at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:520)
at swervelib.parser.json.DeviceJson.createMotor(DeviceJson.java:120)
at swervelib.parser.json.ModuleJson.createModuleConfiguration(ModuleJson.java:48)
at swervelib.parser.SwerveParser.createSwerveDrive(SwerveParser.java:117)
at frc.robot.subsystems.swerveSubsystem.(swerveSubsystem.java:37)
at frc.robot.RobotContainer.(RobotContainer.java:42)
at frc.robot.Robot.robotInit(Robot.java:30)
at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot.startCompetition(TimedRobot.java:106)
at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:349)
at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.lambda$startRobot$0(RobotBase.java:422)
at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:833)

Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:364): The robot program quit unexpectedly. This is usually due to a code error.
The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.
See Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation for more information.
Error at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:371): The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.

MrPresident:

Unhandled exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.revrobotics.MotorFeedbackSensor

This is the problem.

The instructions say to

Install NavX, CTRE and REV vendor dependencies.

But you haven’t installed the REV vendor dependency

It requires all of the vendordeps even if you aren’t using devices from that vendor because it is programmed to be able to use all of them. I link to the online URL’s here. and offline installation instructions here.
